page.title: 15Religion in Gwyddelwern
page.content: There are three places of worship-the {Parish Church of St Bueno (Church in {Wales), the Methodist Chapel}and the {Presbyterian}Chapel. There is one resident minister who lives at the Presbyterian Manse. The villagers are fairly evently divided between these three with a slight bias towards non-conformism. There is no religious bigotry in the village. The{Church in {Wales}is served by a Curate in Charge, who cares for the surrounding parish under the Rector of Corwen. Services are held every sunday, three times a month in English once in Welsh. The prayer books are printed bilingually on facing pages. The Methodist Chapel is an imposing building on the main road built in 1900. A Welsh service is held every week and the congregation is drawn from scattered farms and the village.
